result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L. Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael L. Stone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael L. Stone was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
DUPLICATE NOTICE
Review hearing on December 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on December 4, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Judge O'Melia has authorized the warrants quashed on cases 17TR657, 15FO1081 & 15FO1080 upon receipt of $50 and defendant has promised all fines will be paid within 10 days.  Judicial Assisant will set matter for review following payment.  (15CM517 also has balance)

1:35 p.m. Defendant Michael L Stone in court via video with attorney Breanna Magallones.  Defendant Michael L Stone in custody.  Magallones states defendant contacted PD's office and is eligible. Calling 15fo1080, 15fo1081 and 15cm517. Court recites payment record. Defendant states water pipes broke in basement and vehicle was hit and needed to be repaired. Court quashes warrants and allows release of defendant from custody. Court authorizes Clerk to reinstate payment plan. Defendant provides mailing address of 709 N. Stevens Street, Rhinelander. Adj. 1:40 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 21, 2017 at 10:00 am.
per Brandi @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
notice of Certification  - not deliverable as addressed -
from defendant - just started new job today - will make payment with first paycheck

ADDRESS INFO for Michael L. Stone
Current: P.O. Box 544, 3041 S Artison Lane, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538 United States  (Effective: 06-21-2016)
Prior: 5845 Forest Loop Road B, Rhinelander, WI 54501

3:11 p.m. Defendant Michael L. Stone in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Michael L. Stone in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin,   along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 16cm499 and 15cm517. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 15cm517 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 15cm499-Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guiltySchiek/Laska/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA assessment and follow-through
Random alcohol/drug testing
Obtain/Maintain full-time employment/education
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs/fines/fees in full. 
Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given.

Calling 150FO1080 and 15FO1081 - review of unpaid fines - warrants issued - Court quashes warrants and allows release of defendant from custody. Court is ordering Defendant to enter into payment plan with Clerk of Court when released from jail and make regular monthly payments. Review hearing for forfeiture cases scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 3:00 p.m. 

Adj. 3:28 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:25 p.m. Defendant Michael L. Stone in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm499 and 15 cm517. Michlig/Laska statement that resolution is close. Bail continued. Adj. 3:25 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

1:20 p.m. Defendant Michael L. Stone in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm499 and 15cm517.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued. Adj. 1:21 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L. Stone in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
